[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [Concurrent modification] If multiple ViewRequests execute concurrently at same ledger_version, can they observe inconsistent state due to cache invalidation races? (Low)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Struct: ViewRequest] [Generic type bounds] For MoveType generic parameters, are type bounds validated to prevent instantiation with prohibited types (e.g., signer, native)? (High)
[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Struct: ViewFunction] [TypeTag validation] Can ty_args contain TypeTag::Signer or other restricted types that violate view function constraints? (Critical)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: convert.rs] [Recursive generic instantiation] Can deeply nested generic types (e.g., vector<vector<vector<...>>>) cause exponential type expansion during instantiation? (High)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: convert.rs] [Phantom type confusion] For phantom type parameters, does validation ensure they're not used in computation, or can attackers exploit phantom types to bypass checks? (Medium)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: convert.rs] [Generic constraint violation] Can type_arguments violate ability constraints (copy, drop, store, key) causing VM execution to fail with undefined behavior? (High)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [Panic on invalid input] Do all code paths handle malformed ViewRequest/ViewFunction gracefully, or can specific inputs cause unwrap() panics crashing API server? (High)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: convert.rs] [Partial conversion failure] If BCS encoding of some args succeeds but others fail, can partially-encoded ViewFunction cause VM corruption? (High)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: aptos_vm.rs] [Move abort handling] Does ViewFunctionError properly sanitize Move abort messages to prevent information disclosure about resource existence? (Low)
[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [X-Aptos-Gas-Used header] Can gas_used value be manipulated or forged to mislead clients about actual computation cost? (Low)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Struct: ViewRequest] [Large argument serialization] Can arguments with deeply nested structures (100+ levels) cause stack overflow during serde_json deserialization? (Medium)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Struct: ViewFunction] [BCS memory allocation] Does vec_bytes deserialization of args field enforce memory limits, or can malicious BCS trigger unbounded allocation? (High)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [Concurrent request limit] Can attackers flood API with concurrent ViewRequests causing thread pool exhaustion via api_spawn_blocking? (Medium)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: aptos_vm.rs] [VM instance pooling] Does execute_view_function reuse VM instances, and can prior execution state contaminate subsequent ViewFunction calls? (High)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [State root verification] Does ViewFunction execution verify state against Merkle root, or can malicious state_view provide forged data? (Critical)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: convert.rs] [BCS canonicalization] Are BCS-encoded args guaranteed to be canonical form, or can non-canonical encoding cause signature verification issues? (Medium)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [Ledger info forgery] Can BasicResponse with forged ledger_info cause clients to accept invalid view function results as authentic? (High)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [Function call timing] Can timing differences in view function execution leak information about resource existence or branch conditions taken? (Low)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [View pattern analysis] Does frequent querying of specific ViewFunctions leak information about user behavior or transaction patterns? (Low)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: aptos_vm.rs] [Error code enumeration] Can attackers systematically try ViewFunction calls to enumerate valid modules/functions and map account state structure? (Low)

[File: api/types/src/view.rs] [Integration: view_function.rs] [IndexerReader dependency] If indexer_reader returns stale table_info, can ViewFunction see inconsistent state leading to incorrect results? (Medium)
